TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SessionStateStoreData extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents session-state data for a session store.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SessionStateStoreData class is used by ASP.NET and implementers of a custom session-state store to pass session-state information to and from the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule>.
The SessionStateStoreData class is used to represent session-state data for a session store to the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule>. The SessionStateStoreData object contains the session-state variable names and values, static object references, and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData.Timeout%2A> information for the current session.

MemberSignature.Value: public SessionStateStoreData (System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection sessionItems, System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection staticObjects, int timeout);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection sessionItems, class System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection staticObjects, int32 timeout) cil managed

Docs.param: The session variables and values for the current session.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData> class is used to represent session-state data for a session store to the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule>. The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData> object contains the session-state variable names and values, static object references, and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData.Timeout%2A> information for the current session.
The <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData> class is used by ASP.NET and implementers of a custom session-state store to pass session-state information to and from the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateModule>.
Custom session-store implementers construct a <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreData> object in implementations of the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItem%2A>, <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.GetItemExclusive%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateStoreProviderBase.CreateNewStoreData%2A> methods.

Docs.summary: The session variables and values for the current session.
Docs.value: An object that contains variables and values for the current session.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Items property references the session-state variables that are exposed to ASP.NET application code using the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.HttpSessionState> class, which is accessed using the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext.Session%2A> property of the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> or the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page> instance.
By default, session-state variables are managed using the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateItemCollection> object. Custom session-store implementers can supply their own implementation of the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.ISessionStateItemCollection> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of objects declared by tags within the ASP.NET application file Global.asax.
Docs.value: An containing objects declared in the Global.asax file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The
StaticObjects property is provided for compatibility with earlier versions of ASP.
Custom session-store implementers can obtain a reference to the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> class for the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> instance using the <xref:System.Web.SessionState.SessionStateUtility.GetSessionStaticObjects%2A> method.
> [!NOTE] > Custom objects stored in the StaticObjects collection must support binary serialization. For more information, see [Binary Serialization](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual int Timeout { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets and sets the amount of time, in minutes, allowed between requests before the session-state provider terminates the session.
